snippet: The move would effectively create a no-fly zone that could help safeguard refugees and give rebel fighters a portion of Syrian territory without fear of crippling airstrikes by Syrian forces.
abstract: Turkey considers stationing Patriot missile batteries along its southern border with Syria; move would effectively create a no-fly zone that could help safeguard refugees and give rebel fighters a portion of Syrian territory without fear of crippling airstrikes by Syrian forces.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Neil MacFarquhar from Beirut, Lebanon; Hala Droubi from Doha, Qatar; Sebnem Arsu from Istanbul; and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: The move would effectively create a no-fly zone that could help safeguard refugees and give rebel fighters a portion of Syrian territory without fear of crippling airstrikes by Syrian forces.

headline.seo: Turkey May Deploy Patriot Missiles Near Syria
headline.main: Turkey Considers Deploying Missiles Near Syria
headline.print_headline: Turkey Considers Deploying Missiles Near Syria

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
